comments:
- Start with an Eclipse SDK with the p2 end-user UI installed
 - Help > Software Updates (Incubation)
 - Select the installed feature that contains the end-user UI.
 - Click "Uninstall"

After brief progress, an error occurs:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Array index out of range: -1
	at java.util.ArrayList.set(ArrayList.java:365)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.sortOperations(NewSimpleDirector.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.generateOperations(NewSimpleDirector.java:130)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.uninstall(NewSimpleDirector.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.ProvisioningUtil.uninstall(ProvisioningUtil.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.operations.UninstallOperation.doExecute(UninstallOperation.java:43)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.operations.ProvisioningOperation.execute(ProvisioningOperation.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.core.commands.operations.DefaultOperationHistory.execute(DefaultOperationHistory.java:511)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.actions.ProfileModificationAction$2.run(ProfileModificationAction.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Meta question: Should the end user be able to uninstall the bits needed by the provisioning UI from within the provisioning UI? They would then be in a dead-end state where they can perform no further provisioning.  Even more, should it be possible to uninstall absolutely everything from within the application (self-destruct)?

I opened bug #204334 for the meta question.
Does the AIOOBE only occur when uninstalling the UI or is this a more persvasive problem when uninstalling anything?
Pascal isn't able to reproduce... I'm installing the m2 candidate now, and I'll try this again.
